title: Let me inspire that great smile of yours
text:
My posting has been up a short while and I already have to edit... Please, I am not looking for a one night stand. Do not send dirty pics. Also, I would prefer to find someone that has weekends off so that we can do things together. 


Why do we make dating harder than it really is? Is it wrong to just grab dinner or a coffee and talk? Why is there so much pressure for it to go perfect? So, you may not be attracted to that person when you meet, but why does that mean you can't have a good evening? Two adults should be able to talk and have a good time without all the prejudice that comes along. With that being said, I am looking for someone who is mature, stable, outgoing and well rounded. I know this is Craigslist, but I know there are good men out there. It feels like we have to put warning labels on our ads these days. I should not have to say that I am looking for someone that is single. If you are not single, you should not be looking. If you have a STD, go on a STD dating site.. It seems simple, but people do not get it. 

A little about myself:

Single
I Have a career

I am active

Things I enjoy:

Country music, but will listen to most anything


About you:

If you think we could be a match, shoot me an email and we will go from there. I hope you have a great weekend and enjoy the beautiful weather!

title: Let's start a great future together
text:
Are you tired of the same game day after day? Are you tired of meeting people with no ambition?

I know I am. I understand that we all have issues and things that we deal with, but I am getting to a point
where I want to find someone normal. I am not looking to be someone's counselor or sponsor.

I tend to find the ones that have addictions, mental disorders, are married, like to play games, lie, cheat etc... How old are we? Dating again has made me feel like I was back in high school. Why has dating become and all or nothing type of thing? Why can't two adults go to dinner or have drinks without it meaning you have to get married? Just because you may not be attracted to that person does not mean you can't have a nice time with them. If you are meeting people with rejection issues then maybe try a different site.

I enjoy the nice things in life, quiet candlelight dinners, watching a movie by the fire, laying in bed just talking about our goals, dreams, desires. When was the last time you found yourself still talking as the sun came up? Those are the best nights.

Gotcha with the headline! It will be changed if I am flagged.

I enjoy many things. I like to camp, hike, go for long weekend trips to anywhere the car takes us. I like adventure and having a good time. I am an extravert with type A personality. Just getting that out there.

I am big on communication. That is the key to a successful relationship. I do not want or need drama.

I do have a career in which I am grateful for. I am just looking for a great man to share life with.

Please be no older than 50, non smoker, employed and mentally ready for a relationship.

title: I just realized I am dating my job....
text:
I have been working too much the last year. I really do enjoy what I do, and strive to be successful, but a girl can't live on work alone! I want to meet someone that I will be so excited to spend time with that I leave work at a reasonable hour and stop working on Sundays. 

Who will excite me? We all have preferences when it comes to the physical qualities. I love a tall man - 6 foot or taller and I prefer men my age or older - 45 to early 50's. When I was a teenager, I used to be told I look like Phoebe Cates. If you have no idea who she is, then you are probably too young for me. I tend to be attracted to a clean-cut, somewhat conservative look. I love when people have their own individual style, but I am just not attracted to men with lots of tattoo's or piercings. What can I say, I love a man in dress pants and a button up shirt. 

I am 45, never married and I have no children. I am 5'7" and slender, but with some curves. These days, I get told I look like Tea Leoni. (I am the first to admit I am not a natural blonde). I don't see the resemblance, but it's a compliment so I smile and say thank you. Madame Secretary is tall, thin, smart and a great boss to her employees - why wouldn't I want to be compared to her? 

The rest is chemistry and there is no list for that. Let's see what happens...

title: "You're Just Too Good To Be True..."
text:
Ha! Going back a few years! So are you in the Denver / Metro area?

Intelligent, an out of the box thinker, classy, youthful, outgoing, spontaneous, confident, mannered, outspoken, compassionate, loyal, direct, and optimistic with a dry sense of humor, penetrating eyes, longer tastefully greying hair, elegant to artsy to Nike with a bit of old hippie thrown in. I have been labeled as sensual, edgy, alluring, mysterious, and recently, as being "east coast poise with noise"....all these adjectives from men, for what that's worth.

I have gained something good from every relationship I have been in. I harbor no ill will towards my past. Two kids, grown, gone, but close with me, no grandkids, though I love the ones my friends have.

I am passionate about music, (enjoy most types, especially live, but nooooo country) literature, writing and most arts. I like to cook light and fresh foods, sing, dance, read, study history, have meaningful conversations, check out architecture, see movies on the big screen, live sports, museums, libraries, old buildings, galleries, ....kinda eclectic interest wise, I guess...I am fine hanging at home watching something good on tv. I am not an "X-treme" outdoors type; I don't ski, scale mountains, or raft....yet....I do love being out of doors...am not a biker babe, but would enjoy riding behind you. Really enjoy checking out new eateries, especially indie ones, not into Vietnamese, Mexican, or deep fried anything.

I would love to meet an intelligent, classy guy who shares some of the same things, no longer has younger than high school kids at home, isn't married, separated, or has a more than necessarily civil relationship with an ex-wife, and is ready to start a new history with me. It is important to me that you do not smoke, and care enough about yourself to be doing the requisite nutrition/exercise/lifestyle deal that has kept you attractive.... both inside and out.

I am seeking intimacy on several levels, and some things I value most in a partner are humor, integrity, courage, and loyalty. I think how you treat and speak to and about others bespeaks volumes about you, and I really notice those things. I love dignity of presence and a kind heart. As for the "looking for someone to complete me" or my "soulmate" - no, not me. Still working on my own puzzle!

The endless email thing doesn't interest me, and texting to me is something that comes after we get comfortable with one another, not as a way of establishing a relationship. 

I would like to add something here that you may find odd, but I'm going to say it anyway. I have posted here before a couple of times last year and have also tried a couple of dating sites. Each time and place, I have been contacted by men who have sent extremely attractive photos and who each have said they are of European background, work for an oil/engineering firm based out of Texas, and are ending their employment with either a plan to move to CO or with some family member who has a home in Lakewood where the stay when they return from Europe....they won't talk on the phone and when I have pressed for a chat, they disappear. If that is you, please don't bother responding, like the military officers in Afghanistan who are widows with young teenage daughters, CL is on to your scam.

I absolutely cannot post a photo here because of some dating site nut jobs, but I would like to see yours, without sunglasses (the eyes say so much) so I can know you are a real person. 

So if you have read this far, please send a note with your photo in which I can see your handsome face and eyes and please tell me about you - the basic who what where when type things so I can have a more complete idea about you and what you are seeking. I will message back if you do and if I think we may have a niche to explore. I am from NYC and have been in Denver for almost 25 years. 

Ready to start making those first and last phone calls of the day....

title: Spring/Summer and beyond 2016
text:
Summer is headed our way. So many great things to do. Live music festivals, Red Rocks, bike riding, hiking, BBQ's, baseball, people watching, garage sales, sitting by the fire pit listening to music, camping and love under the stars (sigh), weekend road trips, motorcycle rides perhaps? The list goes on. Maybe you are feeling the same way and looking forward to it all but hoping to find someone to do all these great things with. Reach out. Take a chance. title: Friends and Compatriots
text:
Hello everyone out there. I am newish to the area. I grew up here but haven't live here for awhile now. I didn't keep in touch with many people who still live in the valley and am not making friends at work because I work as a sub on assignment and I haven't been in any one class long enough to get to know anyone there. 
I do have a very short list of friends including my best friend who lives with me along with her 2 daughters. I don't have kids but since we live together I do have kids at home and that complicates some stuff. And afterall I'm looking for some outside of my house friends. 
Like I said I work as a substitute teacher and I aspire to making teaching a more permanent thing. Or maybe I will be a Mason. I have been enjoying the freedoms freelancing. I try to work everyday but there aren't always jobs and on those days I have plenty to distract myself with but like anyone I'd like to find someone to join me on some of these free days. 
I want to go visit Woodward Park. I've never been! It's snowy now and I don't have chains for my own car but maybe we can visit fish camp. 
My sister lives on Orange County and I drive out there often. This weekend that's where I will be celebrating my birthday! Maybe you like road trips. I love them. In the spring I'm going to Rock Fiesta in Arizona. It's a camp out and I'm not an experienced camper so, I'm nervous about maintaining a minimum amount of comfort. I would like to sleep well. 2 long days requires some good sleep. Do you like goin to rock shows? I do. It's one of my fave ways to blow my last few dollars. Sometimes it's worth living poor to end up seeing My Morning Jacket, Cafe Tacvba, Deftones, Tool or some other bands live. Let's go see a show together. 
Let's watch some tv. Winter is coming and Game of thrones comes back soon. Maybe the walking dead? 
I like going out for taco Tuesday and having some beers. The Tioga Springs beer garden is nice. I'd love to go back with someone. I've also been to Peeves Public house. They have good prices beer pints and an outdoor patio. Show me a place you like to have drinks. I'm a beer person myself but a mixed drink or some nice whiskey sometimes hits the spot. 
I guess what I'm looking for starts to sound like activity partner but it's not. I'd like to get to know you and become good friends. Maybe we click or hit it off or whatever. 
I into my 30's. I am single. Never been married. 3 exes in far distant lands. 
I like to travel and airfares are dropping right around now. Who wants to go visit Chicago because it's $150 airfare round trip? Let's go have deep dish pizza. Visit a museum or my college pub. 
I into science fiction. I enjoyed the new Star Wars very much. Can't wait for more. This summer's Star Trek is much anticipated. This is tre of probably everyone in the world but still with mentioning I think. I'd like to go see Star Wars again and I might go by myself but I'm putting the feelers out to maybe find someone to accompany me. It'll be fun. 
Having said a bunch of stuff and gone on and on I would like to now add that I am into 420. It my favorite way to relax and I like to go out that way. It's not an always thing but sometimes with other like minded people it can get to be. I still lead an active productive life. Clearly I'm not drug free and I know some of you aren't into that.
I'm ok with marijuana but not really much else. Drinking and toking. That's it.

Are there any older or mature men that want the same thing? That 'old fashioned' love that comes from creating a real relationship built on communication and trust. 

I love to laugh, go on adventures, camping, hiking etc. going to concerts, comedy clubs or watching Netflix on a snowy day like today. My parents have been married for 30+ years and while it hasn't been the perfect marriage, I admire what they have. I'd like to have that some day. So is there anyone out there reading this that wants more than a one night stand or fwb?

I'm looking for a guy who is taller than me (I like to wear heels on occasion) genuine, funny, intelligent, and mature. I'm not going to lie and say I'm a Barbie doll, I'm a little heavy and have curves, so if you don't think you'd be attracted to me, then move along. Please put your first name in the subject line to weed out spam. Send a pic if you like, but I don't need one on your first email. Hope there is a nice guy out there!

title: The seasons of life
text:
Hmmm. Postings in "men for women" want cute (isn't cute subjective?), young (okay I get that one), and athletic, petite, HWP, and of course no BBW. So - where does this leave me? I turned 60 on Christmas (am I in the winter of my life?), so I'm not young anymore (unless maybe you are 80?). I think I passed the cute stage many years ago. And, I am not athletic, or HWP. Am I BBW? Not sure about that description, but yes I am overweight. Oh, and even though I've lived here all of my life, I have never liked skiing, and don't Ride the Rockies.

I possess a kind heart and a good sense of humor (if you appreciate sarcasm). I've come out of a divorce and thinking about being with a kind gentleman. Well, wondering if that will ever happen. Divorce recent, but the marriage died many years ago -- that old saying about beating a dead horse. I've gotten over looking for my soul mate, then again never say never. I can be a good listener - I like to hear your stories. I like to talk too -- but will only chat at half time during your football games. 

I don't care about race or have concerns about weight, or other outward appearances. I do think someone that remembers where he was when JFK was assassinated would be of the best age. I have a wonderful job (want to work there for many more years), drive a Buick, and I have a nice place to live. I don't smoke and cannot abide it. I don't imbibe alcohol - if you have a beer now and then (like during the Broncos vs. Pats game today) that's okay, but no drugs (including 420) please. I just don't like mind altering substances.

I like George Jones, Patsy Cline, and Johnny Cash. Also, Janis Joplin, Led Zeppelin, and the Rolling Stones, only to name a few. I like the blues and classical too. Going for walks with my dog is a joy (if you have an unruly dog I can help with that), and movies are fun - my favorites are The Godfather (go figure, I'm really not into violence) and Coming Home. I also like good conversation with good friends. 

If you have a mind (or not) to write to me, please put Nostalgia in the subject line.

To the young of heart.

title: I am here for marriage
text:
I am looking for someone 27-45 in age. 
Race does not matter at all.
Someone ambitious about wanting to live a comfortable lifestyle. I indulge in enjoying the fruits of my labor and work very hard and have many goals in life that I am working towards. 

If you don't meet these basics, it's ok! Just don't flag me! :)

I am looking for a long term relationship that leads to marriage. I want to get married sooner than later, and believe I have a different understanding about marriage than most people. I believe it is about choice and commitment. Obviously love, chemistry, attraction, etc play into it. But if I CHOOSE my partner, day in and day out, it is much more meaningful. Even love can fade. That doesn't mean you can't get it back. But marriage is work. I am at a point where I am ready to commit myself to one person for the rest of my life and I am looking for someone who is in the same place in life. 

So about me. I am 31, I have 3 kids (open to more if life and financials are in order), and a business owner. I enjoy wine and fine dining. I am a huge music fanatic, but am pretty picky about my music. I like to hike and bike and be outside and active. I am very much into eating healthy and taking care of my body inside and out. I'm 5'6" 130 pounds, multi-racial, dark hair, light eyes, I have some tattoos. I love romance and want to have a deep, intimate relationship with my partner. I'm a bit of a hopeless romantic.
I live a relatively normal life. It's always an adventure with 3 boys and a business, but it's pretty normal. I believe in keeping balance in everything that you do. So that keeps me sane. 

Please respond with a picture and some information about yourself. And if this ad is up, I am still looking.

title: The real deal
text:
Not being very productive this morning, I've been sucked in CL reading both men and women dating ads. 

After sifting out the perverted ads everyone else seems to really be selling themselves as these super nice people, with ridiculous qualities they have or want in a partner. Really who says stuff like that? "He has to be brave, kind, honest because I'm happy, peaceful and ambitious"???? 

I'll be honest alright, I smoke cigarettes and drink an entire bottle of wine after work every night. Lush/wino? Absolutely!!! I have more clothes thrown all over my bedroom floor than what's actually hanging on the rack because I change about 5 times before I actually choose something. If you are dating me, I'll bug you endlessly before walking out the house asking which outfit looks the best and get pissed off if you don't take it seriously. My makeup and hair products at all times are scattered everywhere in the bathroom, but I will bitch at you if you leave the toilet seat up. 

I spent my college years as a sorority girl, and still party with my girlfriends as if the party never stops. At one point on a good party night I will no doubt end up on the top of the table or on stage to dance, you'll be embarrassed and everyone will be looking at you to go pick me up off the damn table, carry me out of the bar and take my drunk ass home. Your reward will be crazy sloppy drunk sex with me, though at 4am I may be throwing up in the bathroom. This is okay though because I'll be happy to lose the cocktail calories. 

Speaking of calories, I don't cook dinner and hardly ever eat dinner. I drink a protein shakes instead, so never expect me to cook for you or spend time at the dinner table. I am vain vain vain vain, to the point I'll probably never have kids because the idea of ruining my girlish figure is horrifying. Most likely when I'm an old lady I'll be pumped full of Botox too!! The plan is to stay sexy, and thin at all costs! 

When we go to a concert or all day event with friends we'll end up getting into a fight in front of everyone. You'll mostly be bitching at me about flirting with other guys, ignoring you, drinking too much or telling me how you never get the chance to relax because you're always the one having to babysit me. Eventually we'll make up and PDA. Pretty much all our friends will see us as a toxic bipolar relationship. 

Social media, I will annoy the shit out of you by my addicted phone use; texting friends, hash tagging twitter and posting our couple selfies on FB. 

You always wanted a "independent" girl, not someone always with you every second of the day. But after we're together this idea will drive you nuts. At one point you'll be questioning your sanity when you do a drive by or check in when I randomly have the habit of going MIA on you. Sometimes I'll announce it's a GNO or girls trip weekend. You'll text and I won't reply, you'll call and I won't return your call. This annoys you because you know I'm attached to my phone. I'll stumble in before the sun comes up and you'll be furious. You'll start thinking I linked up with some dude at the bar and drilling me with questions, I'll be screaming back accusing you of being too controlling and suffocating. Some fights will get out of control with me throwing crap and being my naturally bratty self. Later we'll make up, I will use sex as a control tool to get you to stay. Then for a few weeks I'll be on my "best behavior", but it never lasts long. I'm caring but selfish, smart but immature. You'll see I grew up pampered and have sense of entitlement that you'll pet name me Brat for. You will admit my good qualities may be far from the Mother Theresa type but find I don't cheat, don't abuse the credit card and care about my looks, so your standards will sway a bit. 

The idea of taking me as your date to a family wedding, company picnic or holiday party will terrify you. Sure I look terrific and at first act just the lady my dear Mother raised, but you'll find yourself sweating underneath your collar as you start counting up the times I visit the open bar. Then bam it happens, I start stumbling and just called your bosses wife by a different name. I'll talk a little bit louder and start cracking totally inappropriate jokes. Absolutely no peace for you! So yup, that's me in a nutshell. Couldn't even make this shit up if I tried.

Who's up for a date now? Lol

title: Warrior mentality, poet's soul
text:
I doubt I'll find a sane guy here but let's be an optimist.

I'm a hopeless romantic, but let's be honest love is the hardest thing to find now a days. It's like winning the lottery. I find it odd, that relationships I look up to doesn't exist anymore. I like small things... I don't want the world, or to take over the world, or even be someone's world... But I just want to face the world with someone with me, by my side. Some nights are cold, lonely and down right depressing (thoughts filling through my mind) but it would be great to have someone heart beat to listen to, to talk to, to cuddle with. I don't want sex, that is so easy. But I want a connection. Instead I want a connection, meaning, emotional raw relationship.

I'm an intellectual girl. I consider myself 50% extrovert, 50% introvert. I don't bullshit, I say what I feel. That way I won't regret it. If you don't agree, at least we both know I was being real and honest. I love raw conversations, sleepless nights, adventures, poetry, food, movies, art, I adore life. Life is beautiful. title: Fallen and Waiting
text:
To be sent to Earth with no purpose only to find you waiting with no expectations, a broken wing, and a shattered soul. . ..You are my purpose, my fading star to which I am gifted so that you may return to heaven and fly once more. But how to minister to thy wounds so deep? Shall I wash them with my tears and watch you rise like a phoenix from ashes? Or shower you with dew from the gods, dry you with the threads of the universe, and mend your broken wing with pieces of my own fate woven by those fated sisters three? Oh, Dark Angel, let me minister to thy needs and cater to thy whims, for you are my eternal purpose in this dying world and dreadful existence. 
You are my song. Every verse is a new page added to my existence, to my very being. Listen to the lyre, harp, flute, and cymbals. . .. They sing of grace, tragedy great, and a rugged beauty beyond compare. Every angel, demon, and gods alike stand in awe of the truth that is you. Time has stopped to exist because every living thing weeps with you. Your tears fall and mother earth ushers them to the rivers and oceans, giving life, water, and nourishment to those who need it. The words you speak are manna to my ears, giving me life where none was. How is that you, my dark angel, have become my savior? When did the tides turn and rise to drown me in the sea of your love? Rise my warrior and take to the skies. Heaven has called and needs you once again. Take my halo from my head to wear upon your brow for there are those who seek to call you fallen and take your place in battle. This halo of mine contains my life and with it I must give all that inside me so that finally you may live. 
And I become the broken and fallen one to whom heaven has no need.

title: Brighter than the stars above you, shine.
text:
What can one say about someone like me? I have tried to break it down and it inevitably becomes lengthy. So be prepared.

I am in my early thirties, I am short by many many standards and my body type is: I've had a kid, surgeries for health issues, and I've lost like 80 lbs. A woman's body who has endured a lot and still fancies decorating it colorful tattoos and odd style clothes and an even odder personality. A beautiful disaster. I am very sexual, however fragile, and of sexuality, I am whatever I guess. I can find either gender attractive at times. Art, music, and venturing on the unknown fuel me. I am an artist. Music is my strongest antidepressant I've found, though I admit I struggle with depression but I do take care of it. (no one's perfect bro.) The unknown can be so many things and nothing all at once. I am 420 friendly, she's my best "buddy". Mind expanding, blowing, giggling and watching things that normally are insignificant times are also important to me too. It's lovely to experience that with someone you love. I am educated and my mind is interesting to pick. I have many views and I enjoy learning other's views as well. Just don't try to convince me you're right over me. We are all entitled to our own opinion. I do not believe in organized religion. I have studied it, and it isn't for me. I don't want to be with someone that's hardcore anything. Just do your own thing. I do mine and that's all that is needed for me. I am a talker when I find information that is interesting, so if you are close minded, please move on. I live a lonely little life. My kid doesn't live with me but I love her more than anything. I have been truly single since November and I am so tired of the crap, the drama, the lies, the weirdness, the heartache, the tears and ache of losing that person I loved more than he deserved. I don't find being and living alone great. It's hard on me. I crave affection and love like a drug. I've been in long term relationships since I was 15 and just find it too much on my heart to be alone any longer. I am physically unable to have more children but I do enjoy kids. I raised my daughter to be a wonderful young lady and now her dad is taking a turn. 

So what do I want? Well... I have dated younger men most my life, and where am I now? Alone... why? Well, you can't force someone to be with you if you aren't their perfect love. And the men that were younger; I really gave my heart to them and they left me behind, so I am reluctant to be with anyone a lot younger than me again. It's not something I can endure right now; being abandoned again. But if you can prove you are real and can handle yourself and are mature then I will think about it. But I think I should be with an older man or same age. (I can't give you kids, would that even be fair for a younger man to give up that experience, for me? I don't think so. It would hurt my heart). But who knows. (late twenties to late forties is acceptable as long as you aren't a POS haha.) Come what may. Don't be afraid to love, my heart falls way fast and don't be scared if yours does too. I do not want someone jealous and controlling. I can tell immediately if that's the case after meeting you and I have a tendency to use colorful language to tell others what I think about that. I am sarcastic and I will make fun of you so you better just get used to it. But know if I do it a lot, then I care. I am more attracted to thinner, taller than me, white or lighter men. I know, blah, hate me, it's just my preference. My kid is half puerto rican, so if YOU have issues with race, move on. Okay, let me just sum this up since I am having issues paying attention to writing and am just singing along to music and falling over a lot bc I really love certain songs and I get over zealous swaying to the music haha, whatever. YOU: Loving, caring, not jealous, honest, taller than little me, thinner or HWP at least, open minded, love music, willing to learn about depression and how it affects a woman like me, willing to love someone that needs a strong person to hold her on her bad days; meaning you. Accepting that I have had some health issues and lots of outside and strenuous activity makes me physically ill. Not that IDW to do those things, it's that I can't really. But it's a trial and error process so have patience, I will try at least once. (But don't leave me behind, because when I do catch up, I will flick you so hard in the throat... pinky swear.) I need you to understand that my very best friend right now in the world is a straight man and yes I did date him once, but he is all I've had for a while and I will never give him up for anyone. He is there for me all the time and I love him to death. We aren't a thing but I tell him everything and we pity party ourselves being alone once in a while. (He wouldn't admit it... if you read this you do too, so shhhhhhhhhhhh-tfu lol xoxo) I want to fall in love. I want to love and be loved and not looked down upon but sought after to learn from and questioned to understand me. I do the same. I am the most giving and thoughtful person in the world. Even the person that left me in November said he had never met someone like me in that aspect. It makes him feel bad for leaving me sometimes haha. Oh well. /shrug. 

If you got through all this, congrats, you have no life, like me, and that's okay! Just kidding. Reply with a picture. If you can't or won't after one request, then just don't bother. 

Yes I am real, The Walking Dead is on tonight and if you were here watching it too and spoke while it's on, I'd kick you out lol. So if you like things like that, cool! Dr Who, Goth Music, Melodic Metal, GoT, Penny Dreadful, FaceOff, Z Nation, anything vampires, scary movies, zombies, Rob zombie movies, (and his wife is hot, whatever.) Interview with the Vampire, 28 days later, etc... some of my faves.

title: Looking for love
text:
I thought I'd give this a try and see where it takes me. 

A little bit about myself -- I am a very creative and compassionate person. I enjoy helping others as best as I can. I'm a great listener and very empathetic. In my free time, I love to draw, read, and write. I am hoping that one day I will be able to publish books of my own. I'm a bit of a nerd -- I love D&D and I do play video games (Primarily Xbox, and primarily RPGs). I moved to Colorado a few months ago and have fallen in love with the mountains and all the city has to offer. The Botanic Gardens has become one of my favorite haunts. I love touch -- even platonic touch. I love giving hugs, I love holding hands -- and in a more romantic setting, I love kisses, cuddling, general affection, and of course intimacy. I mention that because I know that some people prefer not to be touched or it makes them feel crowded where as I am the opposite of that. 

I like to try and be a better version of myself than I was the day before every day. I want to experience all that life has to offer. I enjoy traveling and seeing new places for that reason. I have a list of all the places I want to see in my lifetime! My body type is currently a bit above average - I say currently, because I have been striving to get healthier after watching my parents go through so many health complications, and so I've actually lost about 30lbs in the past five months alone. I only mention this because I do understand that some do like a particular body type - if I am not your type, please do not email me if this would be an issue for you. I also value uniqueness; I think everyone should be their own person without worrying what another person might think. I've had my hair all sorts of colors in the past, I have two lip piercings, and I do have one tattoo with plans of getting more. I love good tattoos and I love piercings. I love it when someone isn't afraid to be themselves. I am not religious, but I don't mind religion so long as it isn't shoved down my throat. I am happy knowing that everyone has their own unique beliefs. I do drink socially, I don't really care for smoking pot, but I have eaten a few edibles that were not bad. I don't smoke cigarettes, but I do enjoy hookah. 

I am twenty six years old and I am looking for someone between the ages of twenty two and thirty six. That number can be edged a little in either direction, but not by a great amount. I am looking for someone who is responsible -- someone who has their own place or has a place with roommates, etc. Basically, you do not live in your parent's basement, unless of course there is a good reason for it. I do know some people who did remain with their parents for longer, but for good reason. Just be a responsible adult! Haha =) I am looking for someone who is honest and trustworthy because I feel that is the basis of a relationship. I am not looking for anyone who is currently with anyone else -- I am not that person, and you should not be either. Hoping to find someone who does share some common interests with me, but opposites do attract, and I am open minded to trying new things as well! 

Your picture gets mine! Please, no nudes. I'd like to get to know you first. I am not looking for a hook up. Include some of your hobbies or a little bit about yourself -- be unique in your writing! Stand apart from the rest. Don't send me two liner emails. I actually have today and Monday off of work so we could potentially meet up and hang out somewhere.

Two adults should be able to talk and have a good time without all the prejudice that comes along. With that being said, I am looking for someone who is mature, stable, outgoing and well rounded. title: Looking for love
text:
I thought I'd give this a try and see where it takes me.

A little bit about myself -- I am a very creative and compassionate person. I enjoy helping others as best as I can. I'm a great listener and very empathetic. In my free time, I love to draw, read, and write. I am hoping that one day I will be able to publish books of my own. I'm a bit of a nerd -- I love D&D and I do play video games (Primarily Xbox, and primarily RPGs). I moved to Colorado a few months ago and have fallen in love with the mountains and all the city has to offer. The Botanic Gardens has become one of my favorite haunts. I love touch -- even platonic touch. I love giving hugs, I love holding hands -- and in a more romantic setting, I love kisses, cuddling, general affection, and of course intimacy. I mention that because I know that some people prefer not to be touched or it makes them feel crowded where as I am the opposite of that.

I like to try and be a better version of myself than I was the day before every day. I want to experience all that life has to offer. I enjoy traveling and seeing new places for that reason. I have a list of all the places I want to see in my lifetime! My body type is currently a bit above average - I say currently, because I have been striving to get healthier after watching my parents go through so many health complications, and so I've actually lost about 30lbs in the past five months alone. I only mention this because I do understand that some do like a particular body type - if I am not your type, please do not email me if this would be an issue for you. I also value uniqueness; I think everyone should be their own person without worrying what another person might think. I've had my hair all sorts of colors in the past, I have two lip piercings, and I do have one tattoo with plans of getting more. I love good tattoos and I love piercings. I love it when someone isn't afraid to be themselves. I am not religious, but I don't mind religion so long as it isn't shoved down my throat. I am happy knowing that everyone has their own unique beliefs. I do drink socially, I don't really care for smoking pot, but I have eaten a few edibles that were not bad. I don't smoke cigarettes, but I do enjoy hookah.

I am twenty six years old and I am looking for someone between the ages of twenty two and thirty six. That number can be edged a little in either direction, but not by a great amount. I am looking for someone who is responsible -- someone who has their own place or has a place with roommates, etc. Basically, you do not live in your parent's basement, unless of course there is a good reason for it. I do know some people who did remain with their parents for longer, but for good reason. Just be a responsible adult! Haha =) I am looking for someone who is honest and trustworthy because I feel that is the basis of a relationship. I am not looking for anyone who is currently with anyone else -- I am not that person, and you should not be either. Hoping to find someone who does share some common interests with me, but opposites do attract, and I am open minded to trying new things as well!

Your picture gets mine! Please, no nudes. I'd like to get to know you first. I am not looking for a hook up. Include some of your hobbies or a little bit about yourself -- be unique in your writing! Stand apart from the rest. Don't send me two liner emails. I actually have today and Monday off of work so we could potentially meet up and hang out somewhere.

So, I work in marketing/advertising/. I have to watch focus groups for 5 hours tonight (6-11) you heard me.

Anyone up for some witty banter during that time? Well, let's be honest, after my 3rd glass of wine and 900pm rolls around, the banter will just be me bitchy about stupidness.

About me (so you can direct your questions accordingly). I am divorced (relatively recently). I am 34. I am happy.

I am in great great great shape. I am a [solidcore] fiend. I'm tall (sorry) 5'7 and do keep it very toned. But I also love to eat out and travel. I love new experiences and trying different things. I am incredibly open minded and tolerant of everyone.

I love going to the theater and concerts and have many subscriptions. I love getting dressed up. But don't mind a night at home for some board games and wine.

Basically, if I'm going out, I like to do something a tad more adult. But if I'm staying in, it's PJs, board games and going to bed early.

If you want to know anything else, just ask. I'm pretty easy to speak with. If I don't get to your response and it is good, there's a pretty good chance I get to it tomorrow (as i'll be a zombie and my boss isn't in the office).

title: No games!!!!
text:
First off, I am a single mom *not* looking to replace my child's father. I'm independent and don't need anyone's help to survive. I'm already doing it on my own. That said, I do have split custody so I do have free time every now and then. Every now and then being the key words so don't waste my time if you want to play games. 

Now ...what do I want? I've been single for awhile now. I've dated but nothing that has really peaked my interest. I'm looking for a man between the ages of 26-35 who has his shit together. This means he can pass a background check (I won't be doing one but this is standard to have any job), intelligent, assertive, honest, and most importantly, funny! I love someone who I can be myself with and while I'm serious about what I'm looking for, my personality is laid back. I make really stupid jokes and say things like "that's what she said". 

I don't want to rush into anything and will never get married again. Unless I find someone super amazing...then I'll reconsider. I don't want anymore children. I have one and that's enough for me. If you have kids, that's okay. As far as looks are concerned: I'm not attracted to heavier men. A few pounds to lose? That's fine, so do I. Race isn't an issue and neither is hair/eye color although I am a sucker for dark hair....just saying. 

Either way, reply to my post. You never know! Change the subject to "that's what she said" so I know you are paying attention. Replies with pictures will move to the top of the list. And please, keep your dick in your pants. No one wants to see that before they even get a chance to see your handsome face. 

Almost forgot--be single!!! 100% single. No exceptions.

title: Bdsm Slave seeks Master or Daddy

Nature of the relationshipEdit

Sexual slavery is a consensualexchange of power by the submissive to the dominant, though the scope of the surrender of discretion may be limited and may be withdrawn at any time.

The types of activities that the sex slave may be expected to perform are usually defined in advance and sometimes spelled out in a slave contract, a document that outlines the desires, limits, and expectations of the parties. The sex slave is often expected to perform sexually, though typically many relationship-oriented dynamics are also clearly negotiated, including clothing, diet, speech restrictions, household affairs and schedules, though the details may be left to the master or mistress. Typically outlined are clear expectations of whether the couple will be monogamous or polyamorous, and if there would be permission or expectation of sexual interaction with other people. Otherwise, a sex slave may be expected to perform many of the same functions that are expected of a slave/submissive, including wearing very revealing clothes, being shared, wearing a slave collar or leash, S&M activities, or bondage.[3]

Depending on their contract, a sex slave may be traded by the master, facilitated by sex club events, personals in BDSM interest magazines or internet based social networks.[4] Commonly, a slave is also said to be a collared slave, though not every slave wears a physical slave collar.

title: 15 Things That Make You Want to Give Up On Dating
text:
Like most things, there are pros and cons to dating. Sometimes it may seem like a necessary evil on the road to finding love (and it is), but that doesn't mean you don't sometimes want to throw your hands up in the air and say, "forget it! I'd rather be single for life." The planning, the getting your hopes up about a new guy, the being disappointed, the feeling like there are no decent guys left in the world, we've all been there. They do say you'll find the One when you stop looking, so maybe it's time we just put that little piece of dating wisdom to the test.

1. Guys who'd rather text forever than make solid plans. What is he waiting for? Does he need a hand written invitation in order to hang out with you in person? Even worse when you take a chance and ask him out, and he still can't seem to commit to anything.

2. When you find out he already has a girlfriend. But we had such a connection, what do you mean he's not single? Why would he flirt with me like that then?!

3. When your friend meets her soul mate after being on OKCupid for literally 24 hours. How is it that you could scour that site for weeks and barely scrape together a couple dates, and she finds the Chris Pratt in the online dating rough without even having a photo up?!

4. When he invites you out and then "forgets" his wallet. Look, we have no problem paying for our half, but when it's clear he had no intention of paying at all, we have to consider sneaking out through the bathroom window, and leaving him to wash dishes to pay off his debt.

5. When his idea of a date is bringing his entire entourage to meet you at a bar at midnight. A date shouldn't involve him making sure his wing man has a shot with one of your friends.

6. When you think it's going well and he freaks out because you left a spare tampon in his bathroom. Or worse, when he accuses you of leaving it there, but it was actually his roommate's girlfriend.

7. The third time you break up with the same person. Somehow it seemed more productive to revive an old relationship than find someone new. You were wrong. Twice. Dating is just too much work.

8. When you can't seem to get past the first date, ever. Even when it seems like the first date was fantastic, somehow planning the second date becomes harder than trying to schedule brunch with Beyonce.

9. The unsolicited dick pic. Once second you were innocently talking about the third season of House of Cards, and the next, there's a dick on your phone.

10. Watching your friend go through a bad breakup. If you start dating someone, there's a pretty good chance that crying mess on the couch eating an entire bag of Smart Food dipped in peanut butter will be you in the foreseeable future.

11. Coffee dates. Unless you're going on dates at 9am, caffeine is ill advised. No one wants to put any effort into first dates anymore, meaning you end up drinking way more lattes than you should be, and every date becomes pretty dull and repetitive.

12. When he looks nothing like his picture. The question is, do you call him on it, or do you force a polite smile, chug that latte, and get out of there asap?

13. When he leaves you with the bill because you didn't want to hook up. This guy doesn't even pretend he forgot his wallet. He just doesn't come back from the bathroom. So that's why he chose the corner booth with no view of the door.

14. Finding out he's a racist, homophobic, pro-life, misogynistic actual crazy person. It's official, there are no nice, normal guys left. You can end the search now.

15. When staying home in your pjs is more appealing than going out. You could go on another date with this guy, or that guy, but why bother? At least your cat doesn't have uncontrollable gas or make you watch UFC. Once you realize the gloriousness of being single, there isn't much short of a millionaire who looks like David Beckham that will convince you to go on a date ever again. At least for now.

title: Women of Craigslist
text:
I am a female. I thought I would read the posts here on Craigslist to get idea's for an ad. It quickly became apparent to me that you tender souls sit down and write in one of three categories.

The first is from women that have a 'dream man'. You describe him in great detail. Handsome, great dancer, loves kids, can do everything around the house, etc. Ladies, there is only one problem with this. You created a dream, now you are advertising to fill that dream. Tell me, how is that working for you? Be honest. Fantasies are fun but I think men would prefer you approached this in a more realistic manner.

The second comes mostly from the more mature women. They are looking for something they lost. A partner lost to circumstance, chance or perhaps an unrequited love from long ago. The mission is to find a collage of the 'best of' attributes of the men that have impacted your life. Worse yet is those who lost the love of your life and are looking for a mirror image of that person. The living cannot and should not compete with ghosts.

The third group are very self focused. They lay out everything about themselves. As if the search is for a male reflection of yourself. You look at your search from only your side. There is almost zero wiggle room for the men. Again I will ask how that is working for you?

Perhaps everyone needs to remember that there's only one thing that must be present in a relationship to make it work. Compromise. Give and take. Agreeing to disagree. Accept another person into your life that is no more perfect than you are. We all have a few things we won't compromise on. Religion, smoking, drugs, etc. Perfectly reasonable and acceptable. If your list is longer than 3-4 items maybe you should re-examine what's truly important.

If we all put away our lists and look at this search in a more down to earth way we'll have a much better chance of success. Let's expand our perspectives for who is acceptable to share our lives with. After all isn't it why we are here?

Here's to each one of us finding someone that makes us happy.

**I posted this a few weeks ago. The male response was overwhelming. They would love to meet you ladies. Give them a chance.**

title: Compatibilty
text:
I've been single for awhile, dated here and there but nothing serious. At this stage in life I trust my intuition, I'm not desperate or dating just to date. I've posted before and I get a vibe in the first few emails and if I don't feel something I don't respond. I had to come up with some kind of system, either that or spend ridiculous amounts of time emailing for nothing. I also trust if we are meant to be together, we'll meet.

I've been on the path of self discovery, self love and therefore healing. No matter what it looks like, an awake life is a very different life. I appreciate emotional awareness in a partner. I still believe in the healing power of love. I haven't given up on how I look. I've been told I'm attractive and for the most part comfortable with who I am.

The dilemma is that I miss the physical part of being in a relationship (not just sex - I find the touch of a loved one very healing). And yet, I'm not satisfied being physical with just anyone. I want it all. Willing to give it all as well.

So are we compatible? Here's a glimpse of what I find appealing:

We are on our own spiritual/healing path and also want to share a spiritual connection with a partner. (I'm not a God fearing woman, that's not the God I believe in).
We are awake and self reflective.
We are fit physically; fit or working on it, affectionate, playful, health oriented but not necessarily purists and are tall (I'm 5'10).
We are creative, open minded, passionate, generous, independent and also love being in partnership.
We're mostly home bodies but enjoy getting out, have an adventurous side and a sensual side.
We live within 45 min. of each other, I want to be able to see each other without a road trip.
We find each other attractive, even hot at times.
We are both single and looking for a LTR.
We know that being compatible doesn't mean we like and dislike all the same things, but that we coexist well.

If this resonates with you and you're in my age range (give or take 10 years), tell me about yourself and let's see what the possibilities are. A picture would be nice.
Thank you.

title: 15 Things That Make You Want to Give Up On Dating
text:
Like most things, there are pros and cons to dating. Sometimes it may seem like a necessary evil on the road to finding love (and it is), but that doesn't mean you don't sometimes want to throw your hands up in the air and say, "forget it! I'd rather be single for life." The planning, the getting your hopes up about a new guy, the being disappointed, the feeling like there are no decent guys left in the world, we've all been there. They do say you'll find the One when you stop looking, so maybe it's time we just put that little piece of dating wisdom to the test.

1. Guys who'd rather text forever than make solid plans. What is he waiting for? Does he need a hand written invitation in order to hang out with you in person? Even worse when you take a chance and ask him out, and he still can't seem to commit to anything.

2. When you find out he already has a girlfriend. But we had such a connection, what do you mean he's not single? Why would he flirt with me like that then?!

3. When your friend meets her soul mate after being on OKCupid for literally 24 hours. How is it that you could scour that site for weeks and barely scrape together a couple dates, and she finds the Chris Pratt in the online dating rough without even having a photo up?!

4. When he invites you out and then "forgets" his wallet. Look, we have no problem paying for our half, but when it's clear he had no intention of paying at all, we have to consider sneaking out through the bathroom window, and leaving him to wash dishes to pay off his debt.

5. When his idea of a date is bringing his entire entourage to meet you at a bar at midnight. A date shouldn't involve him making sure his wing man has a shot with one of your friends.

6. When you think it's going well and he freaks out because you left a spare tampon in his bathroom. Or worse, when he accuses you of leaving it there, but it was actually his roommate's girlfriend.

7. The third time you break up with the same person. Somehow it seemed more productive to revive an old relationship than find someone new. You were wrong. Twice. Dating is just too much work.

8. When you can't seem to get past the first date, ever. Even when it seems like the first date was fantastic, somehow planning the second date becomes harder than trying to schedule brunch with Beyonce.

9. The unsolicited dick pic. Once second you were innocently talking about the third season of House of Cards, and the next, there's a dick on your phone.

10. Watching your friend go through a bad breakup. If you start dating someone, there's a pretty good chance that crying mess on the couch eating an entire bag of Smart Food dipped in peanut butter will be you in the foreseeable future.

11. Coffee dates. Unless you're going on dates at 9am, caffeine is ill advised. No one wants to put any effort into first dates anymore, meaning you end up drinking way more lattes than you should be, and every date becomes pretty dull and repetitive.

12. When he looks nothing like his picture. The question is, do you call him on it, or do you force a polite smile, chug that latte, and get out of there asap?

13. When he leaves you with the bill because you didn't want to hook up. This guy doesn't even pretend he forgot his wallet. He just doesn't come back from the bathroom. So that's why he chose the corner booth with no view of the door.

14. Finding out he's a racist, homophobic, pro-life, misogynistic actual crazy person. It's official, there are no nice, normal guys left. You can end the search now.

15. When staying home in your pjs is more appealing than going out. You could go on another date with this guy, or that guy, but why bother? At least your cat doesn't have uncontrollable gas or make you watch UFC. Once you realize the gloriousness of being single, there isn't much short of a millionaire who looks like David Beckham that will convince you to go on a date ever again. At least for now.

title: Strangers are friends waiting to be made
text:
As I sit here and ponder on what I am looking for and what I desire, I had to take time to reflect on those in which I have met on here. 

Over the past 6 months I have learned so much about myself, about dating, about who I am, who I want to be and most important, what I am looking for in a partner. 

In that time, I have loved, I have lost, I have created great memories, but most of all, I have become a stronger, better woman. 

The heartbreak was almost unbearable, but I am not looking at with any regrets. I was a scared, weak, fragile woman when I met the man that changed my life forever. He turned me into this beautiful woman, who is strong, confident, loving, and yes still a little fragile. The stars were all aligned the night we met. Little did I know that the stars would slowly fade, and in time go their separate ways. He as often questioned why he had such an impact on me. My answer to that is: He treated me like a woman, he had respect for me, and he showed me what love was all about. 

Since this man left my life, I have found it to be a struggle to find someone of quality. That is why I question if this is the right place to look. That is when I am reminded of him and all hope comes back, that there will be that one amazing man out there for me. I can't give up and waste this precious heart by not sharing it with the right person. 

With all that being said, let me tell you a little more abut myself: 

I am single, I have a professional career, I also have children, my own place, my own vehicle, and a kindred spirit. I enjoy going for walks in the evenings, long mountains drives to nowhere, outdoor concerts, a glass of wine by the fireplace, a cup of coffee on the patio, camping, watching movies, cuddling and many more things. 

I am looking for someone between 35-50, employed, independent, romantic, fun loving, outgoing, has moral, family values, and not afraid to show emotion. 

So, after reading my short story, if you are interested in getting to know me more, all I can say is that you won't regret it. Even if we don't have a physical attraction, we can have a wonderful friendship. 

I look forward to hearing from you. Have a great weekend.

title: Spring - a time for renewal
text:
So, how come it's so hard to find the one we love and want to share our life with? I think a lot has to do with the fact that the internet controls almost everything. It allows us to post but if we don't want to reply we don't have to. Or, we can reply for awhile and then just drop off the face of the earth if we want to. We can tease each other without ever seeing each other. We can lie, cheat and show each other fake pictures if we want. Or, the picture rules whether you will meet this person or not regardless if you might be compatible. Why? Because the internet allows us to. 
What has happened to good old romance, meeting in a public place, being able to laugh, be honest and respectful of each other, not expecting sex right away, and sharing a walk, movie, art gallery or museum? Why can't we get to know each other? Everything today is so now, now, now, instant gratification. I'm an old fashion woman. Maybe, because I'm older (57) is why I'm not so now, now now, I was brought up with the Ten Commandments and the golden rule. Two concepts that a lot of people just ignore today. Stop and smell the roses!
Also, why is it so hard for some people to communicate effectively? If you don't like what you see or something has pissed you off, just talk about it nicely and say what you mean. I hate liars and people who ignore the situation. Obviously, not into games.
Would love to meet a man who is honest, sophisticated, a gentlemen who has a warm heart, has his life together, smart, FUNNY, sensual, articulate, knows what he wants in life, will treat a woman with respect, love and admiration. Someone who loves animals. 
It would be nice to find my last lover, friend and companion here on Craigslist but not sure it will happen but if you don't put yourself out there you won't see if you will get what you are looking for. Right? Please put your favorite mexican food in the subject line. Please be a non-smoker of cigarettes but 420 friendly.

title: Only if you like nerdy, chubby girls
text:
***See? Not trying to pull the wool over anyone's eyes. So, if fat chicks disturb the fuck out of you, go ahead and click that back button. And while I appreciate the thoughtful emails about how fat cows are dumb, lazy and can't attract a man....please know, your words have really no impact on my psyche or self-esteem...sorry to bum you guys out.***

I know there are awesome guys out there that appreciate thicker chicks. I know this because I've dated them, been in relationships with them, and was even married to one. And all the better if you dig whip sharp, intelligent, science geek sorta girls. And, well, it's not enough to just like smart girls, you have to be similarly intelligent or else we'll never get along. I'm definitely more introverted (not that you'd ever guess during conversation) and really loathe small talk, but get me on a fascinating or politically incorrect topic and I will have plenty to say. I love sci-fi/fantasy/horror books/shows. Battlestar Galactica, Game of Thrones, Helix, Z-Nation, Walking Dead. I watched a lot of PBS NOVA, Frontline, Discovery documentaries and nature programs growing up and I think that pushed me to pursue a science based career.....and the best part? I LOVE what I do....every day. 

Good stuff: I'm super cute, affectionate, giving, nurturing, intelligent but also street smart, capable, independent. Easy-going, not high maintenance, not into drama, bickering, fighting. ( I'm also not really into the fact that shit about Kim Kardashian pops up in my news feed. Seriously, when did vapid, dumb bitches suddenly become news worthy?) I'm also an excellent chef and baker of all things yummy. No kids...unless you count one awesome-sauce hound. Oh, and I'm a stickler about being on-time everywhere I go. I like weird movies, horror movies, B movies, scary movies. I also love music...and have a VERY eclectic palette. 

Bad stuff: I have a low threshold for bullshit, liars and people who make excuses. Ditto shitty people and/or dumb-asses. I frequently misplace things I need on a daily basis like my car keys and wallet. I'm not an adrenaline junkie so, no, I won't be skiing or snowboarding off the sides of mountains with you. I'd rather ramble around a forest hunting down animals and edible mushrooms than scaling snow-covered summits (OMG it's almost like I don't belong in Colorado!!!) I also have a bad habit of enjoying tickling people who are really ticklish. And...I have a potty mouth. 

Anyway, again, really only interested in chatting with guys who have their lives together, live independently, aren't riddled with drama. Brownie points if you're taller than me (Colorado is unilaterally populated with short guys...not to say I have a problem with that, when you're tall you get used to dating guys shorter than you). You should be able to hold your own in conversation, be friendly, and probably on the nerdy side yourself. I do have a 'thing' for cute white guys with dark hair and glasses are....awesome. :) Please also be close to my age...so.... let's say 29 to 40.

title: Compatibilty
text:
I've been single for awhile, dated here and there but nothing serious. At this stage in life I trust my intuition, I'm not desperate or dating just to date. I've posted before and I get a vibe in the first few emails and if I don't feel something I don't respond. I had to come up with some kind of system, either that or spend ridiculous amounts of time emailing for nothing. I also trust if we are meant to be together, we'll meet.

I've been on the path of self discovery, self love and therefore healing. No matter what it looks like, an awake life is a very different life. I appreciate emotional awareness in a partner. I still believe in the healing power of love. I haven't given up on how I look. I've been told I'm attractive and for the most part comfortable with who I am.

The dilemma is that I miss the physical part of being in a relationship (not just sex - I find the touch of a loved one very healing). And yet, I'm not satisfied being physical with just anyone. I want it all. Willing to give it all as well.

So are we compatible? Here's a glimpse of what I find appealing:

We are on our own spiritual/healing path and also want to share a spiritual connection with a partner. (I'm not a God fearing woman, that's not the God I believe in).
We are awake and self reflective.
We are fit physically; fit or working on it, affectionate, playful, health oriented but not necessarily purists and are tall (I'm 5'10).
We are creative, open minded, passionate, generous, independent and also love being in partnership.
We're mostly home bodies but enjoy getting out, have an adventurous side and a sensual side.
We live within 45 min. of each other, I want to be able to see each other without a road trip.
We find each other attractive, even hot at times.
We are both single and looking for a LTR.
We know that being compatible doesn't mean we like and dislike all the same things, but that we coexist well.

If this resonates with you and you're in my age range (give or take 10 years), tell me about yourself and let's see what the possibilities are. A picture would be nice.
Thank you.

title: Could you be my forever?
text:
As I sit here and ponder on what I am looking for and what I desire, I had to take time to reflect on those in which I have met on here. 

Over the past 6 months I have learned so much about myself, about dating, about who I am, who I want to be and most important, what I am looking for in a partner. 

In that time, I have loved, I have lost, I have created great memories, but most of all, I have become a stronger, better woman. 

The heartbreak was almost unbearable, but I am not looking at with any regrets. I was a scared, weak, fragile woman when I met the man that changed my life forever. He turned me into this beautiful woman, who is strong, confident, loving, and yes still a little fragile. The stars were all aligned the night we met. Little did I know that the stars would slowly fade, and in time go their separate ways. He as often questioned why he had such an impact on me. My answer to that is: He treated me like a woman, he had respect for me, and he showed me what love was all about. 

Since this man left my life, I have found it to be a struggle to find someone of quality. That is why I question if this is the right place to look. That is when I am reminded of him and all hope comes back, that there will be that one amazing man out there for me. I can't give up and waste this precious heart by not sharing it with the right person. 

With all that being said, let me tell you a little more abut myself: 

I am single, I have a professional career, I also have children, my own place, my own vehicle, and a kindred spirit. I enjoy going for walks in the evenings, long mountains drives to nowhere, outdoor concerts, a glass of wine by the fireplace, a cup of coffee on the patio, camping, watching movies, cuddling and many more things. 

I am looking for someone between 35-50, employed, independent, romantic, fun loving, outgoing, has moral, family values, and not afraid to show emotion. 

So, after reading my short story, if you are interested in getting to know me more, all I can say is that you won't regret it. Even if we don't have a physical attraction, we can have a wonderful friendship.

title: Looking for my snuggle bunny

I feel that we don't give enough chances to the ones that we are so quick to judge as not being good enough. I feel that we are sheltering ourselves from really experiencing what true love and happiness is. title: I Think It is Time
text:
I'm looking for lightning to strike twice. I had a great relationship with a wonderful man, but he passed away 18 months ago. I don't know if it is possible to find another wonderful man, but I think it is time to try. I miss cuddling, I miss having someone to talk to. I miss the sharing that comes with being in a committed relationship. I miss the intimacy (in all it's forms). I'm hoping there is someone out there that is looking for that too.

I'm 32 year old teacher, and I don't have any kids (just two kitties) but I want them and I have no problem if you do. I'm not looking for a one-night stand, I want something lasting that grows. 

Two things that might be deal breakers about me. I want to be honest because if these bother you, why waste my time and yours. First, I am a big girl. I am working on it, but losing a spouse is hard. Some people drink, some turn to other things, my source of solace was food. I have moved past that, and I am on my way to a much healthier (and smaller) place, but if you can't deal with someone who is larger, then please move on. Second, I live with my mother. She moved in with my husband and I because she is getting older and I didn't want her living alone. I am in no way dependent on her, but this bothers some people. We are a package deal, so if you are one of those people, please move along. I personally believe that family is supposed to take care of each other, and I am looking for someone who feels that same way.

Now for the good things. I am a nerd who loves to read and play video games. I volunteer at Comicon and I love the Zombie Crawl. I love playing games; card games, board games and especially poker. I love camping, fishing, and driving in the mountains. I love to travel, and I have a lot of places I want to see. I love the Broncos and the Rockies. I would like to get into playing softball and I plan on taking up martial arts as well. I have a lot of things to offer the right person. If you are out there, please respond back with your favorite Super Hero. I can't wait to meet you.

Pic for Pic

title: Beginning Again Today
text: Having been through and in the process of going through some difficult times, I am looking to continue and move forward in a positive way. I am recently single and I would love to get to know someone who has a similar goal in mind. I'm liberal in many ways but always open to and curious about the other sides of a given argument. I am creatively inclined but just as curious about people who are curious about other things. I'm loyal to the people in my life and want to bring positive energy, fun as well as practical aspects to peoples lives and would love to meet someone committed to the same. While I'm curious about you and your life situation, I am much more interested in who you are than where you are if that makes sense. Feel free to drop me a line if you can relate to this post or if it intrigues you in any way. And feel free to ask me anything. I hope you're having a good day and staying warm. Old man winter is haunting us for sure. Haha.

title: Hello!!

title: We all need and deserve love!
text:

Thanks for reading and I can't wait to hear from you! ~R~
